sections.heading: Concept
sections.content: Swaraj refers to self-rule or self-governance, a key idea in Indian independence movements.

sections.heading: Historical Usage
sections.content: Leaders like Bal Gangadhar Tilak and Mahatma Gandhi popularized the term.

sections.heading: Philosophical Aspect
sections.content: Gandhi connected Swaraj with self-discipline and ethical living.

sections.heading: Modern Impact
sections.content: The notion continues to inspire democratic and decentralized movements.
